Class Word

  • java.lang.Object
    • Word

  • public class Word
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a single word as a lexeme, which is morphologically exactly as it appears. (From a linguistic standpoint, "surface form" is more appropriate, but this is not relevant to the task as assigned because we are not compressing morphological features.) A word is defined as a sequence of alphabetic characters only. For simplicity, all words are stored in lower case.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Word(java.lang.String lexeme)
      Creates a word from a lexeme converted into lower case.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Word

        public Word(java.lang.String lexeme)
        Creates a word from a lexeme converted into lower case.
        Parameters:
        lexeme - - the lexeme, which is an unbroken character sequence consisting of alphabetic characters only. Uppercase is legal but will be converted to lowercase
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lexeme is invalid
